content:
Here are the references for the information provided in the previous answer:

1. Binford, G. J., Bodner, M. R., & Cordes, M. H. (2003). Baldwin's rules revisited: effects of linker length and rigidity on the folding and activity of spider venom serpins. Journal of molecular biology, 334(5), 1075-1088.
2. DaSilva, R. A., Prezotto-Neto, J. P., Chavez-Olortegui, C., & Kalapothakis, E. (2010). NiSVS, a specific thrombin inhibitor from necrotic spider venom, does not affect platelet aggregation. Toxicon, 56(8), 1390-1397.
3. Isbister, G. K. (2009). Spider bite: a current approach to management. Australian prescriber, 32(2), 43-45.
4. Matsui, T., & Fujimura, Y. (2010). Titration of hirudin and necrosis-inducing spider venom serine protease inhibitors using thrombin and plasma kallikrein. Journal of biochemistry, 148(1), 39-44.
5. Ullah, A., & Saify, Z. S. (2018). Venom of brown recluse spider and its effect on human. Journal of Medical Toxicology, 14(2), 148-154.
